de.systemagmbh.tools.math
Interface ISysRealFunction

All Known Implementing Classes:
CSysChiSquareDistribution, CSysExponentialRandom, CSysRangeArgumentFunction, CSysWDistributionFunction
public interface ISysRealFunction

This interface defines the functionality of a mathematic function of one variable R->R. Since Java does not provide pointers to function, this is the way to pass an arbitrary function to an algorithm. It is useful to find 0-Points, max and min, do Taylor-Expansions, calculate Integrals,... of any CSysRealFunction. See CSysMathTool for some standard algorithms working on CSysRealFunctions.

Example of Usage: 

 

	import de.systemagmbh.tools.math.*;
	...
	double precision=0.001;
	Interval interval=new Interval(0.0,1.0); // specify integration interval;
	
	System.out.print("The integral of sin(x) in the interval "+interval+ "is: ");
	System.out.println(CSysMathTool.rombachIntegral(interval,precision,
	new ISysRealFunction()	// anonymous class instance
	{
	   public double getValue(double argument)
	   {
	      return Math.sin(argument);
	   }
	}      ));
	System.out.println("to a precision of:"+precision);
	
	double exact = Math.cos(interval.lower) - Math.cos(interval.upper);
	System.out.println("should be exactly:"+exact);

Version:

H.Helmstreit
